website_summaries.verdict: There’s nothing quite like pouring a sampling of high-quality, slow-cooked turkey stew that’s good enough for you to eat, to convince a dog to eat their dry food.
pros: Only 8 ingredients and the first is turkey bone broth
Excellent for dogs with common food allergies
cons: Somewhat pricey, but you can expect superior quality with this topper

customer_reviews.title: My dogs tell me it's delicious
customer_reviews.text: I'm not quite sure how to judge the flavor. I'm not up for trying this personally, but when I asked my dogs they said it was delicious, so I'm leaving this review on behalf of them. One is extremely picky with his food (he likes to have parmesan grated on every meal) and he seems to like this food for the most part (big win). The other doggo snarfs this down like it's proverbial crack. Nice portion sizes for two dogs to share as a food topper.
customer_reviews.author: Bryony

customer_reviews.title: Puppy suddenly cares about eating meals now 😂
customer_reviews.text: My puppy seems to hate all kibble. We've tried 3 different brands and it's been a daily stressor to try to get him to eat anything other than treats. The first time I opened one of these pour overs he started going nuts!!! I've never seen him so motivated for mealtime! He now eats the whole meal in one go!! Amazing difference. He is only 7 lbs so I've been mixing about a tsp of topper into his kibble and that has been plenty, so one carton can last many meals. Also the packaging is quite clever and makes it easy to store for multiple days without mess. Needless to say we'll be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Dog approves and i get peacecof mind!
customer_reviews.text: My picky 10lb Shih Tzu loves these! Since she's a senior, 12, i wanted a quality sauce or topper to soften her kibble from time to time. Both her & i love & trust Honest Kitchen. It's a nice, thick gravy consistency- not runnyvor thin as other brands have been... And i know she's getting the best ingredients. She loves all three- the lamb w/kale & broccoli, chicken w/kale & broccoli & turkey w/kale & broccoli. You can see chunks of each. HK doesn't skimp on the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: KimAnne

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell....doesn't seem right....
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the first box, I thought it was spoiled. The smell was horrible and the consistency was like a paste! Tossed it and opened another one and it was the same. My dog only gets a couple of teaspoons with each meal, so I offered it. He ate it with no adverse effects. I prefer the lamb and beef stew formula and my dog actually seems to like that one better.
customer_reviews.author: DemolitionGirl

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this stew. I'm able to stretch it to 3-4 servings by watering it down a bit to a thin gravy and topping his kibble with it. What I love most about it are the clean, quality ingredients and the fact that it adds a lot of flavor to his dry kibble but only with the addition of a small amount of calories (77 cal/box). The downside, as others have mentioned, is the elevated price. These are very small boxes for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that my dogs would not eat enough as they were getting older and so I bought this. I have four dogs and 3 are 11 years old and 1 is 14 years old. They love this product. I noticed they really were still eating pretty well and really did not need to use this but worried they would go out of date so I opened one and they loved it!
customer_reviews.author: MayaTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves The Honest Kitchen. She gets tired of food easily so after she started getting bored of the dehydrated grain free chicken recipe, I bought this to entice her. She eats her food all up again.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Chihuahuas Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My two chihuahuas gobble their food with this on it. They’re normally very picky but with this on their Honest Kitchen Clusters and a little warm water, they think they’re eating gourmet food!
customer_reviews.author: ChiMom20

customer_reviews.title: Yummm!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don’t know about the flavor of this product 😁, but my doggies like it and it smells like food to me! I have use the Honest Kitchen dehydrated dog food and find it to be very high quality. I would recommend this brand of product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Cow

customer_reviews.title: Very chunky consistency, dogs loved them!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loved these! I was a bit surprised at the size of the cartons- I expected them to a bit larger, and the consistency of the stew was a lot meatier than I expected. It says “pour-over”, but it was more of a “plop in”. My dogs loved it, so I’m still happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Lidia

customer_reviews.title: Loved the idea, Dog refuse to eat it
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of this as it offers an easy nutritional boost when we travel. Our dog eats Honest Kitchen dehydrated food (when she doesn't get home cooked dog food) but refused to eat this (even when served on top of her favorite chicken). She is a bit picky (and spoiled) but hoping she'll learn to eat this as it's a great way to get the nutrients she needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Oh, does my dog LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: She LOVES this stuff! and it's all good for her!. I feed it to her on top of her kibble, and she tends to lick the "pour over" off first, and then eats. It's good food, good for her, and she loves it. What more could I ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Joolz

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: This absolutely changed eating time for my dog. She would never touch her food until late at night, only eating once a day, if that. However, the first time I gave her some with her kibble, it was gone. She absolutely loves this stuff with her kibble and will now eat all of it and regularly. As for humans, it looks like vomit because of the spinach and texture. Also doesn’t smell the greatest, but my dog loves it and that’s all that matters. The packaging is great - easy to store and open. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Thuy Ho

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, human grade gravy to flavor picky dogs kibble.
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out on their food as soon as we got it and a did not hesitate to eat their food this time. The ingredients are human grade and very healthy. Please to see that turmeric was also one of the ingredients which is good for our older dog. Are dogs can be picky eaters and this will help with the struggles of mealtime.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great 👍🏻 Product 😃
customer_reviews.text: I have a Very picky Chi .....So the heavy kale was a problem for him . All I know is from my stand point all their product look and smell like our food (human) He also won’t touch kibble AT All🤪 I’m talking even the new ones that are supposed to be better. So I make his food so I added this to his food and he ate it.But alone or over kibble he wouldn’t touch it .
customer_reviews.author: Tawnya Osbakken

customer_reviews.title: My super picky Great Dane approves
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior Great Dane that is super picky, he sometimes won’t even eat the incredibly expensive Fresh food. That’s when I use these pour overs, when he’s being extra picky he’ll pretty much eat anything right up if it’s covered in these pour overs. Honest kitchen also had a new Patè product which is also a hit. Honest kitchen in general is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Coria

customer_reviews.title: Good product, not great value.
customer_reviews.text: First, pay attention to the size, I thought these were the more standard size dog stew cartons, they are not, they are only 5.5oz each. My dog seemed to love the stew/gravy product. Honestly, I would have never purchased these at this price if I had paid attention to the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beaux didn’t like it!
customer_reviews.text: Looks bad. Smells bad. My dog wouldn’t eat his food when I poured it over. It doesn’t matter how healthy it is if they don’t touch it. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: SharonRose

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. Have an older dog who refuses to eat his regular food. I mixed this with some dry food and he gulfed it down. Have had no problems with him eating afterwards. Also it has not impacted his digestive system. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jsal818

customer_reviews.title: Not all dog will like for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be tasty for my 6 dogs that I take care of, but they did not like them, had I give them away!
customer_reviews.author: nancy a.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This may taste good to a dog, but it was not too appealing to use. The package was hard to open and the product is runny - forgive me, but it kinda looked like green slime.
customer_reviews.author: K. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Easy and yummy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these pour overs. I have since switched to homemade food but this was a good transition start.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley A

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice!
customer_reviews.text: My cockapoo loved the pumpkin ones I got at pet store. However, this combination caused diarrhea, and she would not eat again. For me it was a waste of money since I bought the 12 pack.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great to make stew
customer_reviews.text: Love human grade ingredients and it works to make a little stew for my guy who is a picky eater. He laps it up!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Picky dogs might not like this
customer_reviews.text: Don’t think the dogs liked the flavor after a week or so. Not sure why they ate it at first then decided not to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Diaz

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my cats' diet!
customer_reviews.text: I pour it on my cats' food and they go crazy for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A natural addition to your dogs food that they’ll love.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the pour overs. I’m Haley that you use all natural ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: LRE

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn't eat it
customer_reviews.text: It may be good for your dog. Mine wouldn't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Gassert

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: Do dogs really eat this slime? My two wouldn’t touch the stuff. All 3 flavors look the same, are they really different flavors? Who can tell? Don’t even get me started on the packaging. Can’t reseal it and it leaks and it’s super messy to pour. Sorry but, Epic fail...
customer_reviews.author: Earen T. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: THEY LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: It saves the day at my house! No more boring dog food!
customer_reviews.author: SSG V

customer_reviews.title: My pups love these
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. Can get yhem cheaper at a local store.
customer_reviews.author: Colliemom2

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was going to be more like a broth. A little disappointed
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: It smelt awful. My dog wouldn’t eat it. I gave both boxes to my friends dog.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Sobieck

customer_reviews.title: My dogs don't like it. They're tough critics
customer_reviews.text: The box is deceivingly smaller than what you think you're going to get. It smells like broccoli soup and my dogs don't really like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Smithee

customer_reviews.title: Kale
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on accident, since their previous chicken product did not have Kale. But this broth is very green so I decided to look up Kale, and it is NOT a recommended ingredient for dogs! It can cause kidney stones! I had to throw away the entire box I ordered. I don't think this should be labeled as SUPERFOOD for dogs. It may be okay for human intake, but vets don't recommend kale.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Y Kim

customer_reviews.title: Dog wouldn't eat it
customer_reviews.text: Granted, my dog is a picky eater - I bought these hoping to entice her to eat her kibble. She took one sniff and didn't even try it. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Jay D. Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Finally A Food Topper That’s Tasty And Wholesome
customer_reviews.text: We were at our wit’s end trying to find soft foods that appeal to our 17 year old dog. She has limited teeth and has always been a picky eater. This topper makes her canned food much more palatable, and since using it, her plate is always licked clean. I like that the first ingredient is chicken bone broth, a nutrient she certainly needs. The entire ingredient list is simple and impressively wholesome—so much so that I tried some myself. Both the dog and I agree—it’s tasty. Our dog is about 10 lbs—we can get about 2-3 servings from each box. I like this cooked stew topper idea much better than gravy style ones, which contain salt.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyfingers

customer_reviews.title: Convenient But Messy
customer_reviews.text: I like the convenience of this product. According to the package instructions, you're supposed to get two servings out of each container. However, I'm getting four or more servings. The dogs love the flavor (and it does smell like a nice soup or broth), though it does make one or both gassy (which isn't typical for my dogs). I do wish someone would design an easy-open container. This is an aggravating container, and I end up splashing some of the broth on my hands. Honest Kitchen, please develop a container that is truly easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: A little something to make a dog’s food more appetizing
customer_reviews.text: Our dog can be a picky eater at times. These Pour Overs are a good way to entice him to eat when he decides to stick up his nose at his regular food or is distracted from eating by something else. Sometimes though, even these aren’t enough enticement. The ingredients seem healthy enough and I guess it smells good to him, although not necessarily to me. The little cartons can be a bit tricky to open, and although they are supposed to just pull apart, it required a scissors for me to open them. For our 15 pound dog, there is enough in one carton for 2 meals.
customer_reviews.author: PT Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Looks Revolting; Dog Doesn’t Agree
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest and say I was taken aback when I opened up a package of this dog food topper. It looks just like diarrhea. It is a thick brown liquid with strands of green slime, which I assume is spinach. Really, I’ve never seen anything that revolting that was meant to be eaten. Fortunately, my dog did not get the memo and thought this was the greatest thing that ever happened to him. The ingredients are good and 100% human grade food, although you are told not to eat it yourself (no chance, buddy, no chance). I think it’s a good product but don’t think I would buy more because it’s hard to look at.
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: We sometimes use wet food on top of the dry food our dogs normally eat as a change of pace, or treat. This works well in that regard. Unlike some, this isn't so large that we have leftover when we're done with both dogs. Dogs loved it, but they love anything so that's really not saying much. But it's a bit pricey for a dog food additive that gets put on the already purchased food. But the fact that they're using people grade food, none of the common junk often found in pet foods, helps make the cost more palatable.
customer_reviews.author: LegoDad

customer_reviews.title: Good for picky dogs to jazz up their usual food
customer_reviews.text: My dog is getting so that he doesn't like his ordinary canned dog food. Even premium fresh dog food he isn't always enthusiastic about. These pour overs are just the thing to get him interested and start eating. Once he got a taste, he finished his whole bowl of food. I am familiar with Honest Kitchen and their products are good quality with wholesome ingredients. Have tried a couple of their other items and the dogs seemed to like them, as well as this one. Give it a try if your dog is not eating as enthusiastically as he once was.
customer_reviews.author: David L Hutchins

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, Not For my Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving the Superfood Pour Overs 3 stars because the list of ingredients appear to be high quality. I'm deducting 2 stars because neither of my dogs cared for it and I didn't care for the carton it comes in. My dogs tried to eat around the Pour Overs. I'm not sure if it is the taste or the consistency, which is sort of like a mushy stew. The carton is probably a good way to keep any leftovers fresh, but I found it difficult to open without using scissors. The directions say it can be opened by tearing along a perforated line, but I wasn't able to do so.
customer_reviews.author: T. Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Great for sick dogs and spoiled dogs alike
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this stuff, especially Sadie who was recently diagnosed with an autoimmune disease. All her medications affected her appetite and that made it hard to get her to eat and even harder to get her to keep it down. These pour overs gave a big flavor boost to her bland diet and she continues to enjoy them now she has transitioned back to her regular food. These are also great to pour over kibble if you don't usually add canned food to your dogs food. They are convenient and smell like soup instead of canned dog food.
customer_reviews.author: knitting ninja

customer_reviews.title: Healthy ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I have the world’s fussiest eater of a dog. What she doesn’t like today, she may like tomorrow. She doesn’t like canned food, she doesn’t like dry food, she will sometimes eat homemade dog food with ingredients suggested by our vet... but I just never know. I poured half a carton of this Honest Kitchen Pour Over food on her kibble yesterday, and she ate the Pour Over and ignored the kibble. Who knows if she’ll eat it tomorrow. But for now, I give the product 5 stars for its healthy ingredients and because fussy Sophie ate it.
customer_reviews.author: JoanOH

customer_reviews.title: Sucker your dog to eat the dry food
customer_reviews.text: I dog sit often so I see many types of dogs. Sometimes, because they are not familiar with me, they don't eat as much, perhaps showing a sign of nervousness. Other dogs just don't like to eat that much. I know it's strange. When I have dogs that are looking at their dry food and don't touch it much, I pour this over there dry food and it usually always works. So if you have a fussy dog and who is not eating enough, then you should definitely get this and you might be surprised by the results.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Tapon

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Since my husband died three weeks ago, our two chihuahuas haven’t been eating as well. They were moping. Even adding a bit of moist food didn’t help. The first morning I split this between the two of them, they cleaned up every bit of kibble. The second day was the same. This morning, I actually had to force the stubborn one outside to do his business, because he was sitting at his bowl not willing to wait a second. So, I can pretty much assure you that they REALLY like this.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Whets Their Appetites
customer_reviews.text: Yum. this is a simple and healthy way to whet a picky eater's appetite. the ingredients are human grade and include turkey, spinach, kale, broccoli and tumeric. It looks and smells like real food and my dogs love it. Although the ingredients are sourced from around the world none are from China. While I would prefer ingredients sourced from the US or at least North America, at least there is nothing from China. There are two servings per container. I find that it makes food appealing when a pet is recovering from illness or surgery or just as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Antigone Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves
customer_reviews.text: This is my dog's absolute favorite foods. He gets so excited when he sees the little boxes. He almost weeps with despair when I only give him 1/2 box ( there are 2 servings to the box). I swear he smells the food while it's still in the shipping box. He nose the package around until I open it and his tail starts wagging the minute he sees it. It makes him happy. While he is scarfing it down, his tail wags the entire time. This is one big dog pleaser and made from healthy ingredients too. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pour over - stand back!
customer_reviews.text: To say my dogs were "enthusiastic" about this extra flavor treat is not really fully describing how much they like it. They ate their first bowl while the wagging the get-along part with gusto. For my dogs this is their way of saying "nom nom nom nom nom". Yes - it's a winner. Also, it's made in the USA with, and indeed they say this on the label, NO parts from China. And it smells good.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Animals like these
customer_reviews.text: Got these to encourage an older pet who had small cell lymphoma of the small intestine to keep eating dry food, as she was struggling to keep weight on. It worked well, and she really seemed to enjoy these flavors. Box can be sometimes a bit difficult to open, and they don't close well, so be careful when storing leftovers in the fridge because if they get knocked over, it makes a big mess. The boxes are also not recyclable.
customer_reviews.author: Epilady

customer_reviews.title: Two dogs had problems with this, but the other five really like it
customer_reviews.text: My dogs all like the pumpkin version of these pour overs, so I thought we would try this one with the kale and greens. Unfortunately, one of the seven won't eat a bite with thus mixed in it. A second dog had diarrhea after one meal with just half a carton added to his regular food. The rest of the pack likes this and had no digestive drama with it. The ingredients are fine and there's nothing in these that I find questionable or sketchy. I think it's just this flavor that's an issue for two of my hounds.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Wolf Down Their Food With Pour Overs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love Superfood Pour Overs. They like all the varieties they have tried, and turkey is no different. This turkey stew pour over smells like broccoli to me. The ingredients list has spinach, kale, and broccoli. Vegetables included, my dogs "wolf" down their food with pour-overs.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela V

customer_reviews.title: Dogs gobble this up!
customer_reviews.text: Human grade dog food, oh how spoiled my dogs have become! They do love these pour overs though. It makes them gobble up their kibble in minutes! Each little carton is 2 servings and you can fold the carton back down to store and left overs for later. I personally feel that dogs have begun to live longer lives, and I think its thanks to the changes that are happening in the dog food trends. Feeding our pets better quality foods in my opinion is helping extend pets lives.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda D.

customer_reviews.title: Well-balanced treat
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this pour-over (and my cat does too if she can get to it first). It has tons of nutrients. The packaging is clean and effective and doesn't put a lot of plastic or metal cans into a landfill. It opens easily just as it's designed to do. It is easy to store. My only concern is the price, which is high. But I'm thinking that's what you have to pay for this kind of quality. My dog is worth it, that's for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Gentleheart

customer_reviews.title: Two of three dogs liked it. 100% human grade meeting FDA standards
customer_reviews.text: Out of 3 dogs, 2 liked it, 1 didn't. I think the ingredients are healthy; as a matter of fact, this dog food topper is 100% human grade and meet FDA human safety standards. To be sure your dog/s would like it, I would suggest buying a couple packs before purchasing a case of 12.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Our Dogs Love This and It Helps My Larger Pup With His Allergies
customer_reviews.text: This looks gross to me; I definitely was not tempted to taste it myself but both my dogs gobbled this down and kept licking their bowls to get every last taste. Our larger dog usually has red allergy eyes to some extent and the redness is much less and the white part of his eyes much whiter when eating this superfood pour over from The Honest Kitchen over his dry dog food. I am very impressed with the quality and innovations of The Honest Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Darlaina Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Except the Box
customer_reviews.text: I love Honest Kitchen products and so does our Toy Pom. Great healthy ingredients. The only thing 'wrong' is that it is a little messy because you need to cut off a little triangle from the top to pour it out. A screw cap would be better.
customer_reviews.author: CorpGovNet

customer_reviews.title: My picky eaters love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs. Two are picky eaters. The other two will eat anything. And they do if you let them. These containers are a bit tricky to open, but once you get the hang of it, not so bad. Make sure to shake them well prior to opening. There is plenty enough for multiple servings in each box. I place them in a small ziploc and set them upright in the refrigerator so as to be ready for the next meal.
customer_reviews.author: Tell It Like It Is

customer_reviews.title: Big hit!
customer_reviews.text: My basset loved this. He got excited as soon as I pulled the carton out of the box. I dumped it all over his plane cable. He plowed through his cables in minutes. Then he got the curtain out of the recycle bin and promptly lick that completely clean and shoot it up. He obviously loves it. The ingredients are very healthy. It is thickened with tapioca. It is grain free. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: 💚TosaTat💚

customer_reviews.title: Great quality; a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: At almost $2 per box, these are a little spendy. However, you don't have to use up the whole unit quantity in one feeding - you can drizzle just a little on the dry feed once in a while, and store it in the fridge for another time.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver DeMille, TJEd

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Loved It
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loved it. All I had to do was open the container and pour a little on their food and they followed me around for more. I had to let it soak in or they would have just licked it off the food. I think this is great for picky eaters or if your vet approved, I'll dogs who just wont eat. Its enticing and could help. You get a good amount and the containers make it easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Aalea1

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it, may have given him a bit of moderately smelly gas
customer_reviews.text: The dog really likes these turkey and spinach pour over on top of his regular chow. We dinner the cats eat the dogs good but they all came down to try and get some and they are very picky. The dog likes it well enough to.protect it from the cats. It may have contributed to some smelly has but if so.It was not horrible just a little swampy, we can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Jentoft

customer_reviews.title: Our cockapoo is CRAZY for this
customer_reviews.text: This was a HUGE hit with my 10-year-old Cockapoo. He's not crazy about kibble but with this poured on top, he gobbles it up. I especially love that with this he eats the kibbles too (as sometimes when I add wet to dry he laps up the wet food but eats around the kibble or spits it out) and that it doesn't seem to give him any digestive upset or irregularly. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Book Addict

customer_reviews.title: Gobble gobble
customer_reviews.text: My dog gobbled this up with pure happiness. He doesn’t love regular canned food and especially hates ground wet dog food. I put this over the top of his dry food and he ate it right up with no hesitation. This is unusual and makes me very happy. The fact that it’s 100% human grade is amazing. I will definitely get these for him again!
customer_reviews.author: H.F.

customer_reviews.title: THE best pour over/topper!
customer_reviews.text: We like Honest Kitchen brand, but these take it over the top! All three of our dogs gobble this stuff up! It's so nice to have something to add to their dry kibble that gives them variety, is a trusted brand and doesn't break the bank. Great ingredients for them as well. We will continue to purchase the Pour Overs as long as our dogs eat them.
customer_reviews.author: ~purplemoon~

customer_reviews.title: High quality and dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love the Pour Overs and they seem to be made from high quality ingredients. We like to pour them into these grooved mats we have that are meant to be filled with peanut butter and take the dogs a while to eat. We fill up the grid with the Pour Over and the dogs are happy for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Ginsburg

customer_reviews.title: Indy Loves It
customer_reviews.text: The Honest Kitchen Superfood Pour Overs looks almost good enough for people to eat. It is more like stew than dog food. For a good size dog, a Husky like Indy, the Pour Overs works well as a treat placed on top of his regular food. Indy loves it. It is also grain free, with good ingredients. So, it should be good for him.
customer_reviews.author: PaulM

customer_reviews.title: Doggies love it!
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love this and I feel good giving them to them, I pour it over their dry food and they seem to really appreciate it. We have a Golden Retriever, an Australian Shepherd and a German Shepherd, all of whom have different levels of love for food but ALL three of them found these to be very desirous!
customer_reviews.author: Catrina Thomas

customer_reviews.title: My dog is the biggest fan!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is absolutely obsessed with these pour over products. They look like just what they are supposed to look like - you can see the gravy and vegetables and everything in big chunks and my dog is so thrilled to get something more tasty thrown over her regular dry dog food. She literally can't wait for this to be added to her food each evening.
customer_reviews.author: MElise

customer_reviews.title: Our Cheweenie Likes it
customer_reviews.text: The Pour Overs is a nice treat for our little Cheweenie every once in awhile. The ingredients seem to be of high quality. Our dog really enjoys it. For smaller dogs, it is a pretty big size. It doesn't seem like it would store well so we use it all at once. Overall it is a good product our dog enjoys.
customer_reviews.author: Meijer Bjorn

customer_reviews.title: Dog isn't a fan
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that my not-very-picky dog ate around this when I put it on his food. He eventually ate it, and then seemed to like it, but it is not the solution I had hoped for hiding his pills. I think it smells pretty bad and has the gloppy texture of bad gravy. I won't buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Here is my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: A great choice
customer_reviews.text: This was not what I thought it was when I initially ordered it so I ended up giving it to my coworker to try. Her doggy absolutely loved this stuff. She had a bag of food that her little guy would not touch so she poured some of this on it and he ate it all up...
customer_reviews.author: J + W

customer_reviews.title: My dog loved this pour over
customer_reviews.text: While it didn't look like the greatest stuff to ever come out of a box, my dog sure did enjoy it. I put half on her food each night at dinnertime. She acted like a crazy dog trying to devour it all at once. It's filled with great things. No strange smells. Didn't give her gas or any bathroom issues. Just good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Hunting Creek

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Food Toppers
customer_reviews.text: My dog prefers the pumpkin flavored pour over more than the superfood flavor. We were doing half a carton but seems to be too much for my golden, so we scaled back to about a third of the carton each meal. Great ingredients to give to your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Zeus LOVES this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Zeus, my 77-pound pit mix absolutely loves this stuff. I recently got some healthy dog food that he wouldn't touch with a 10-foot pole. When I poured this over the kibble, he scarfed it up in about a minute. This is something I'm going to keep on hand, in case he goes through a finicky stage.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear007

customer_reviews.title: great concept
customer_reviews.text: sheeesh, so hard to evaluate this product... I love the concept... but my dog did not like it? He is finniky, so very hard to knock the product... gotta try these things to know what works...
customer_reviews.author: funbear

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these pourovers and I love that they are easy to open, easy to save half, and not near as heavy as lugging a bunch of cans around. They don't seem to prefer any flavor, they really like them all.
customer_reviews.author: brifinch89

customer_reviews.title: Our pups love it
customer_reviews.text: We have two mixed-breed rescues, both approximately 2 1/2 years old. We've added this to their dry food and they absolutely love it. Great ingredients for them and apparently an outstanding taste!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This makes my dogs happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky eater and this has changed feeding time! I used a spoonful mixed with his quality dry food and he loves it! You can see the chunks of veggies and meat in this, healthy ingredients I feel good feeding to my lads.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Chapple

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it but it stinks!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this pour over, they will gobble up their kibble in seconds when I pour this over top. My only complaint is that it STINKS! But I guess anything for my boys :-)
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Resident Hound really likes this
customer_reviews.text: Our Resident Hound really likes these pour overs.....even more than she likes her occasional scrambled egg treat. Since she LOVES scrambled eggs, that is really solid praise.
customer_reviews.author: Worddancer Redux

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The lads love it. Put it in a Tuppewear after you open it because the smell is unpleasant. Our little guys love it and race to eat their Superfood Pour-covered dried food.
customer_reviews.author: Loren W. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these pour overs being added to their food. They have loved all the flavors we have tried. Pour it over their dry dog food and you have a winning combination. They will gob that good down right away.
customer_reviews.author: FiFi's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Dress up Fido's kibble
customer_reviews.text: My dog was getting fussy about kibble (older dog) and these pourovers delighted her. She gobbled down her dinner. It wets the kibble and makes it a bit softer and adds flavor and interest to a bored, senior dog's diet.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna D.

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great pour over treat. If I put this on my girls dry food, she will eat it with no problem. She loves wet food, so this gravy is a treat for her when she is given dry food.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love this food
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love this food, and it's so easy. Already pre-made. Just open and pour over their regular dry food. Healthy and the love it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Psychic Cypher

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love this. I put it over their food when they have been very good or active. It's expensive but they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Katawampas

customer_reviews.title: Dogs loved it
customer_reviews.text: Dogs loved it. Nice change from mixing in wet food. Looks like quality ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

product_meta.title: The Honest Kitchen Superfood POUR OVERS – Wet Dog Food Topper
product_meta.description: Style:Chicken Stew| Size:Case of 12Pour Overs are healthy & tasty pourable stews to boost to whatever is in your dogs bowl. With a wide variety of flavors, just a few ingredients, and an easy-to-use box, you can easily boost their bowl every day. Guaranteed analysis: Crude Protein (min) 4.5%, Crude Fat (min) 0.5%, Crude Fiber (max) 1%, Moisture (max) 91% The Honest Kitchen Pour Overs are intended for intermittent or supplemental feeding only. This is a complementary food that should be fed along with a complete and balanced diet.
feature_bullets: SLOW COOKED STEWS: Pour these 100% natural, grain free toppers over your pup’s favorite meal to add a healthy boost of tasty nutrition to their everyday routine.
ANTIOXIDANT-RICH: Made with a mix of free-range chicken, spinach, kale, broccoli & tumeric, these chunky meal enhancers give an added boost of green goodness for dogs of all ages & breeds.

EASY TO USE: The BPA-free box conveniently holds 2 servings and can be easily opened, poured & closed back up, eliminating the need for any messy container transfers. Pour Overs will also stay pourable after opening and won't become hard or gelatinous like some dog food cans.

HUMAN GRADE: Introducing the world’s first, and ONLY, 100% human grade wet dog food topper! Pour Overs meet rigorous FDA human safety standards and use only ingredients approved for human consumption so there is no risk of anything questionable & unsafe in your dog's bowl.

NATURAL: This limited ingredient topper is made in human food facility with NO by-products, NO rendered meals, NO grains, NO artificial colors or flavors, and only the highest quality, non-GMO whole foods.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
